definition: to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: The invention of weights and measures in ancient China was one of important achievements in scientific and technological history.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代度量衡的發明是科技史上的重大成果之一。

sentences.english: They all minted coins and had their own standards for weights and measures.
sentences.chinese: 他們都鑄幣幣有自己的標準和度量衡。

sentences.english: Since when has China been using the metric system ?
sentences.chinese: 中國從什麼時候起使用公制度量衡的？

sentences.english: In the 18th century, Europe used a vast range of different measurements.
sentences.chinese: 在18世紀，歐洲使用了很多測量度量衡的方法。

sentences.english: Before that France had different systems for measuring things in different parts of the country. Cloth makers measured cloth with one system.
sentences.chinese: 在此之前，在法國不同的地方使用不同的度量衡制。

sentences.english: Time is needed to completely achieve the single unit of yard-stick measurement.
sentences.chinese: 完全實現度量衡單位的單軌制，需要一個過程。

definition: Qin dynasty (221-207 BC), founded by the first emperor Qin Shihuang 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2], the first dynasty to rule the whole of China
variant of 曆法|历法 calendar
the civil service system/the bureaucratic system
local currency/our own currency/abbr. to 本幣|本币
old system/weights and measures of former times
